CatDescriptText: Mr. William Watson, clerical worker, Homewood and Mr. Jack Matthews, student, Homewood, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 21, 1962, pg. 6 with question: Do you think the Government should investigate Big Steel's hiking the price of steel?"  Mr. William Watson's answer reads: "Yes, definitely, because it will make the cost of small things more expensive."  Mr. Jack Matthews' answer reads: "Yes, because there's no justification for a rise in the price of steel.  They are not doing anything except putting the press on the people."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William Watson wearing light colored shirt with opened collar and jacket with knitted collar, posed in front of store, Downtown; Portrait of Jack Matthews wearing dark hat and dark overcoat with single button at neck, posed in front of store, Downtown
